publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3541# Patricia Ferguson: Support Glasgow’s Local Town Centres—That the Parliament considers that a vibrant, dynamic town centre plays an important part in the lives of communities across Scotland; welcomes the funds being made available for the regeneration of town centres; believes that many of Glasgow’s distinctive local communities such as Maryhill and Possilpark also have town centres that require regeneration; further believes that areas such as Milton would also benefit from the creation of a town centre, and would welcome the provision of funds to support the social and economic development of these town centres across the city. Supported by: Mr Frank McAveety*, David Whitton*, Cathy Peattie*, Karen Whitefield*
S3M-3541# Support Glasgow’s Local Town Centres (lodged on 25 February 2009) Bill Butler*, Mary Mulligan*, James Kelly*
